summary.para: Gets the current text antialiasing mode of the bitmap render target.

returns.para: Returns a -typed value that specifies the antialiasing mode.

summary.para: Sets the current text antialiasing mode of the bitmap render target.

param.name: antialiasMode
param.para: A -typed value that specifies the antialiasing mode.

returns.para: Returns S_OK if successful, or E_INVALIDARG if the argument is not valid.

remarks.para: The antialiasing mode of a newly-created bitmap render target defaults to . An app can change the antialiasing mode by calling SetTextAntialiasMode. For example, an app might specify for grayscale antialiasing when it renders text onto a transparent bitmap.

summary.para: Encapsulates a 32-bit device independent bitmap and device context, which you can use for rendering glyphs.
